author: Newyorkntilikina
body:
Diversify portfolio into every sector - need picks

Apart from ETFs, I'm curious what everyone's favorite stocks are for each sector. There are 11 sectors total and I feel like I'm heavily swayed towards Technology and lack stocks in certain sectors. I'll list my top holdings for each sectors and please list picks for sectors I'm lacking.

**Technology**

* MSFT
* AAPL
* ADSK

**Consumer Cyclicals**

* NKE
* CHWY

**Communication Services**

* SE
* PINS
* DIS

**Industrials**

* UPWK
* RTX
* BA

**Financial**

* LMND
* PYPL
* JPM

**Consumer Defensive**

* WMT

I don't have any stock in the following sectors and would like advice: **Energy, Basic Material, Utilities, Healthcare, and Real Estate.**

author: chowchowchowchowchow
body:
I’m bullish AF. But, if you look at the market Cap of Palantir and Compare it to something like Autodesk who also sells very expensive software, albeit completely dissimilar software in very differently sized packages, you’ll see that Autodesk turns a profit. Palantir is still in the red as far as earnings go. Autodesk’s market cap is roughly 50% greater.  

Twitter has roughly the same market cap as Palantir. It adds very little to the world as far as actual products go, and has roughly the same market cap as Palantir.

Now, imagine in the not so distant future when Palantir’s software is used by every organization in the world. Here they will transform disparate data sets into meaningful  information that is profited off of when acted upon because it adds warp speed to data analysis. This is when you will see the value of Palantir realized. It also seems as though analyzing qualitative data is the first and best step towards developing thoughtful A.I..

Therefore, we are at the beginning of the period where Palantir begins to show value. 40 billion market cap and high volume trades are good signs. But, this is a long hold. If Karp is only half of the backbone that Palantir maintains, to me it is obvious this company is going to be flying beyond the moon.

In the next 4 years I would say 5x current valuations. In the next 10 possibly 20x. If both Palantir and society are able to really grasp the value they are adding to society, this company is going extremely far.

🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀🚀

author: Meymo
body:
This was a fantastic read and mirrors some of my own thoughts regarding the market. I found it interesting that they're also stating that we will have a *"likelihood of low policy rates for the rest of our lives".* Which is the same thing that many commentators on this sub-reddit have also been saying.

For fun, [here's the historical performance](https://www.portfoliovisualizer.com/backtest-portfolio?s=y&timePeriod=4&startYear=1985&firstMonth=1&endYear=2020&lastMonth=12&calendarAligned=true&includeYTD=false&initialAmount=10000&annualOperation=0&annualAdjustment=0&inflationAdjusted=true&annualPercentage=0.0&frequency=2&rebalanceType=1&absoluteDeviation=5.0&relativeDeviation=25.0&showYield=false&reinvestDividends=true&benchmark=VFINX&portfolioNames=false&portfolioName1=Portfolio+1&portfolioName2=Portfolio+2&portfolioName3=Portfolio+3&symbol1=TDG&allocation1_1=5&symbol2=ADBE&allocation2_1=5&symbol3=ADSK&allocation3_1=5&symbol4=ANSS&allocation4_1=5&symbol5=INTU&allocation5_1=5&symbol6=PAYC&allocation6_1=5&symbol7=VRTX&allocation7_1=5&symbol8=ANET&allocation8_1=5&symbol9=MA&allocation9_1=5&symbol10=PYPL&allocation10_1=5&symbol11=V&allocation11_1=5&symbol12=ABMD&allocation12_1=5&symbol13=ISRG&allocation13_1=5&symbol14=ALGN&allocation14_1=5&symbol15=TTWO&allocation15_1=5&symbol16=ETSY&allocation16_1=5&symbol17=XLNX&allocation17_1=5&symbol18=MNST&allocation18_1=5&symbol19=FTNT&allocation19_1=5&symbol20=NOW&allocation20_1=5) of the "high growth" picks that JPM outlines on page 9 (equally weighted, thereby not optimized towards any specific metric), so we can revisit this in 2022 and see how they did. As a data point, historically, it looks like the running CAGR of this blend is around 40.64%. If someone wants to buy this allocation, they can do so quite simply via fractional shares.

body:
